intro: Eschscholzia menziesiana, commonly known as the golden bush poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers and fuzzy, green leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Eschscholzia menziesiana is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
